message:
I asked this question few days ago and got two answers both not working for me.
After days of searching, i got some results and wanna share it with u.
https://github.com/HangfireIO  is a perfect solution for a set of reasons.
- Saving the scheduled tasks in the database.
- availability to cancel re-schedule a task.
- provide a dashboard to know the status of each task.
 and others...
scott hanselman has a blog post about other options if u are  interested,  http://www.hanselman.com/blog/HowToRunBackgroundTasksInASPNET.aspx
story: Ahmed Mohsen shared his post to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Ahmed
description:
I have a table of events each with date and time. what's the best practice to send a notification to all users who subscribed to each event at the event date:time. what I did, for now creating a service to check the coming events and if event time == current time then sends notification and I keep this service running forever.

My question isn't about notification itself, it's how to fire a notification action on the event date:time.

data.message: Since you store the tasks on database, why not run the tasks through a scheduled job on SQL Server?
